term.title: Esin and Markov coefficient

item.text: The left-hand side of one of the various cross-differential relationships that can be obtained from the Gibbs adsorption equation when only one chemical potential(µ) is considered as variable, viz. (∂E/∂µ)T,p,σ =-(∂Γ/∂σ)T,p,µ is the potential difference, T is the temperature, p is the pressure, Γ is the surface excess and σ is the charge density.

sources.item: PAC, 1986, 58, 437. 'Interphases in systems of conducting phases (Recommendations 1985)' on page 446 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198658030437)
